707223f-a.title: Brooklyn: Village Rd. N. - McDonald Ave.
707223f-a.text:
(1)
Village Road North (rear view), north side, between McDonald Ave. (right),
and Village Road East (left), showing in the foreground a barn, once used
by one ''Emmons'' as a slaughter house.
March 2, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(2)
The same, showing, another view of the former slaughter house now
used by the Gravesend Village Nursery.
March 2, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
707223f-a.folder: Village Rd. N. & McDonald Ave., Brooklyn, NY

707220f-a.title: Brooklyn: Village Rd. N. - McDonald Ave.
707220f-a.text:
(1)
61-73 Village Road North, east from Mc Donald Ave., to Village Road
East. Mc Donald Ave.. is in the background, with its B.M.T Colver
LLines overhead; and No. 73 is in the foreground.
March 2, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(2)
The same, showing a close-up of No. 73.
March 2, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

707221f-c.title: Brooklyn: Village Rd. N. - McDonald Ave.
707221f-c.text:
(Tl ylllage Road Northh,north side, between Mc Donald Ave., and Tillage Road
East, showing the Williamson house which was erected in 1780.
This house is 50 feet distant from the former house which was erected
in 1665. Thi land upon which the house is situated, is said to
have been a grant made by Queen Ann to this family in 1665. This
house was demolished in 1929.
1922.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.
(2)
The same, a view west. The Culver Elevated Line of the B.M.T.
is seen in the background on Mc Donald Ave.
1922.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.
707221f-c.folder: Village Rd. N. & McDonald Ave., Brooklyn, NY
